revised_title: Quantum Theory of Electric Birefringence in Molecular Hydrogen
tldr: The authors developed a quantum theory of the Kerr effect in a dilute gas of diatomic molecules, focusing on molecular hydrogen. They observed the temperature dependence of the Kerr constant and found a value for the hyperpolarizability of molecular hydrogen. This study provides a better understanding of the quantum corrections to the classical formula for the Kerr effect, which is particularly important for hydrogen.
